excerpt: In the hills of tea country, this artificial lake offers water sports, boating & cycling.
detail_description: Located in the picturesque hills of tea country, Lake Gregory is an artificial lake that offers a variety of water sports, boating, and cycling activities. The Sri Lankan tourism development authority has planned a project to set up cable cars between Nuwara Eliya and Nanu Oya railway station to enhance tourism around the lake. Visitors can enjoy picnics, horseback riding, paddle boating, or leisurely strolls along the serene environment of Lake Gregory.
name: Lake Gregory
address: Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Green space with many species of plants & birds, plus a playground, kids’ train & pond.
detail_description: Victoria Park in Nuwara Eliya is a historic and tranquil green space located at the heart of the town. It offers well-manicured grounds, winding paths, and a variety of plant species and birds. The park features a playground, kids' train, and a pond, making it perfect for families and solo vacationers alike. Visitors can enjoy picnics under the lush green foliage or admire the towering trees and stunning fountains scattered throughout the park.
name: Victoria Park - Nuwara Eliya
address: XQ99+J7G, PBC Hwy, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Lover's Leap Waterfall, found about 3 kilometers from Nuwara Eliya town, is a stunning 30-meter high waterfall with a tragic love story attached to its name. It originates from Piduruthalagala, Sri Lanka's highest mountain, and cascades down a steep cliff surrounded by typical highland vegetation. The water is collected for drinking purposes and during dry spells, the flow slows down.
name: Lover's Leap Waterfall
address: Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Serene botanical garden featuring lush plantings, including a wide variety of orchids & roses.
detail_description: Nestled in the Central Province of Sri Lanka, Hakgala Botanical Garden is a tranquil oasis boasting an array of lush plantings. Established in 1861 by English botanist George Henry Thwaites, this picturesque garden was initially a tea estate before being transformed into a botanical haven in 1884. Visitors can explore different sections such as the Bulb Garden, Rock Garden, and Upper Flower Garden.
name: Hakgala Botanical Garden
address: WRGC+JJJ, Peradeniya-Badulla-Chenkaladi Hwy, Hakgala, Sri Lanka

detail_description: In Nuwara Eliya, there are numerous tea estates, as expected given the vast hills covered in tea plantations. One notable establishment is Pedros Tea Estate, renowned for its beauty and comprehensive tea tour. Visitors can hike through the plantations, witness the leaf-picking process, observe drying and processing methods, and indulge in a delightful tea tasting experience. Despite substantial growth in Taylors original 19-acre plantation, the harvesting technique has remained largely unchanged.
name: Pedro Tea Estate
address: XQ3F+3FX, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Ornate temple known as the place where Sita was held prisoner in the Hindu epic "Ramayana."
detail_description: Seetha Amman Kovil, also known as Sita Temple, is a significant Hindu temple located near Nuwara Eliya. It is believed to have been built on the spot where Sita, a central figure in the epic Ramayana, was held captive by the demon Ravana. Devotees visit this ornate temple to pay homage to Lord Rama, Lakshman and Sita.
name: Seeta Amman Kovil
address: WRM6+76R, Seetha Eliya, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Attraction featuring sweeping views of the countryside, plus elk, leopards, birds & other wildlife.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Nuwara Eliya, Moon Plains, also known as Sandathenna, is a sprawling green expanse surrounded by lush forests, tea estates, and farmlands. The picturesque landscape offers sweeping views of mountains and valleys. Visitors can embark on a scenic drive or walk to reach the viewing platform where they can marvel at the breathtaking panoramas.
name: Moon Plains
address: Ranhawadigama Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

excerpt: National park & wildlife refuge featuring local flora, migratory & native birds & walking trails.
detail_description: Nestled within the city limits of Nuwara Eliya, Galway's Land National Park is a unique wildlife refuge and national park. Spanning 27 acres, this park boasts a montane ecosystem with diverse flora and fauna. It is renowned for its birdwatching opportunities, housing 20 rare exotic bird species and 30 domestic species. Visitors can explore walking trails while observing local flora and migratory birds in this vibrant bio-diverse environment.
name: Galway's Land National Park
address: Department of Wildlife Conservation, Havelock Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Bomburu Ella Waterfall is a stunning group of around twelve waterfalls located in the Nuwara Eliya District, near Hakgala Botanical Gardens. The main cascade can be reached on a hike of less than a mile from the car park in Perawella and is one of the widest waterfalls in Sri Lanka. It's not crowded with tourists, making it a rewarding half-day excursion from Nuwara Eliya.
name: Bomburu Ella Waterfall
address: Galpalama, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Veteran golf club with an 18-hole course & plush guest rooms, plus a shop with golfing accessories.
detail_description: Located in the hilly terrain of Nuwara Eliya, Asia's oldest golf club, the Nuwara Eliya Golf Club, offers a picturesque 18-hole course and luxurious guest rooms. Established in 1889 by British colonial rulers who were captivated by the tea gardens of Nuwara Eliya, this historic club continues to maintain its pristine grounds. Visitors can relish playing a round or two with friends while immersing themselves in the holiday atmosphere that surrounds it.
name: Nuwara Eliya Golf Club
address: XQC8+M7X, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Nestled near Nuwara Eliya, these two significant animal husbandries fulfill Sri Lanka's dairy needs with high-quality milk, cheese, yogurt, and sweet dairy products. The New Zealand Farm forms part of Ambewala Farm (Ambewela Livestock Company Ltd), situated approximately 4 kilometers away. Visitors can explore the farm at the New Zealand Farm (Pattipola Livestock Company Ltd) rather than Ambewela.
name: Ambewela Farm Ground
address: WQ4X+XX8, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Nuwara Eliya is a city in the tea country hills of central Sri Lanka. The naturally landscaped Hakgala Botanical Gardens displays roses and tree ferns, and shelters monkeys and blue magpies. Nearby Seetha Amman Temple, a colorful Hindu shrine, is decorated with religious figures. Densely forested Galway's Land National Park is a sanctuary for endemic and migratory bird species, including bulbuls and flycatchers.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque hills of central Sri Lanka, Nuwara Eliya is a charming city often referred to as 'Little England' due to its colonial architecture and cool climate. This enchanting destination is renowned for its lush tea plantations, including the famous Pedro Tea Estate and Damro Tea Centre, where visitors can immerse themselves in the art of tea-making.
name: Nuwara Eliya
address: Sri Lanka

detail_description: Nuwara Eliya Post Office, built in 1894, is a colonial-style building with a clock spire and red shingles, exuding British-infrastructure vibes. It is one of the oldest post offices in Sri Lanka and a must-visit for antique enthusiasts. The city's British town vibe is further enhanced by the presence of red telephone boxes scattered throughout Nuwara Eliya. Visiting this historic edifice promises to be a cherished experience for travelers exploring the picturesque city.
name: Post Office - Nuwara Eliya | තැපැල් කාර්යාලය - නුවරඑළිය
address: XQC8+JGW, Queen Elizabeth Dr, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: When in Nuwara Eliya, a visit to Adma Agro Strawberry Farm Shop is a must for any strawberry enthusiast. The farm utilizes different techniques to grow strawberries, resulting in varying yields. Visitors can enjoy tours on a tractor-pulled trailer at the Ambewela location. The year-round cold climate of Nuwara Eliya provides an ideal environment for growing strawberries, and Adma Agro offers an array of strawberry products from fresh fruit to desserts and juices.
name: Adma Agro Strawberry Farm Shop
address: XQ2M+RVX, Peradeniya-Badulla-Chenkaladi Hwy, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

excerpt: A 6,890-foot hill with one tree at its peak with mountain & sunset panoramas.
detail_description: Single Tree Hill, standing at 6,890 feet above sea level, offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and stunning sunsets. The easiest way to reach the peak is by taking a taxi to Swarnagiri Maha Vigaraya Temple and starting the hike from there. As you ascend through tea plantations, you'll be treated to magnificent vistas of Nuwara Eliya town and the Haggala Mountain range.
name: Single Tree Hill
address: XQ57+426, Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Nuwara Eliya Post Office, a charming colonial-era building located in the heart of Nuwara Eliya town, is a historical gem dating back to 1894. This well-preserved Tudor Manor has stood the test of time and remains an active post office today. Its rich colonial history and architectural significance make it a must-visit attraction for tourists exploring the area.
name: Post office
address: XPJX+5RV, Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Bale Bazaar, also known as the winter market, is a popular destination in Nuwara Eliya city. Despite the generally mild climate in Sri Lanka, this location stands out for its cold weather. Tourists visiting Nuwara Eliya may find it appealing to purchase souvenirs here. The market offers a wide range of affordable winter wear options, making it an enjoyable place to explore or make purchases.
name: Bale Bazaar
address: XQF8+59G, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Single Tree Hill, located in Nuwara Eliya, is a popular vantage point offering breathtaking views of the town and surrounding mountains. The hike to the top takes about 90 minutes and rewards visitors with panoramic vistas of Nuwara Eliya Town, Piduruthalagala, Haggala mountains, and more. At the summit, three radio towers and various trees dot the landscape. It's an easy hike that also provides an up-close look at tea plants.
name: Single Tree Hill
address: Sri Lanka

detail_description: The Holy Trinity Church, an Anglican place of worship constructed during the British colonial era in the late 1800s, exhibits a captivating fusion of Gothic and Tudor architectural styles. Adorned with exquisite stained-glass windows and intricate woodwork within its interior, this aesthetically pleasing church is nestled amidst verdant surroundings, offering a tranquil refuge from urban commotion.
name: Holy Trinity Church, Nuwara Elia - Church of Ceylon
address: XQCC+WJV, Church Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

name: Moonplains Safari & Mini Worlds End, Sandathenna
address: Sandathenna, Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Colonial-inspired rooms in an English country-style hotel offering dining, afternoon tea & a spa.
detail_description: The Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya - Heritage Grand is a charming English country-style hotel with colonial-inspired rooms and a historical feel dating back to 1891. The Tudor-inspired mansion features chandeliers, fountains in the gardens, and some of the finest dining options in town, including high teas on the lawn and North Indian cuisine at the glassed-in Grand Indian restaurant.
name: The Grand Hotel Nuwara Eliya - Heritage Grand
address: 05 Grand Hotel Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Pub London Nuwaraeliye is a lively British-style pub that offers a unique atmosphere and an extensive range of local and international beers and spirits. It's also known for serving delicious Western cuisine, providing a refreshing alternative to the local food scene. Additionally, it's located within the scenic Nuwaraeliya hillside Resort, offering excellent service and stunning views. Visitors can enjoy a great experience at this top-rated pub in Nuwaraeliya.
name: Pub London Nuwaraeliya
address: Race Course, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Nuwara Eliya City offers a delightful shopping experience with its diverse bazaars. One of the most renowned spots is Bale Bazaar, known for its wide range of winter products, particularly clothing. This city stands out as the only one in the country with a winter climate, making it an ideal destination for purchasing cold-weather essentials. Visitors can also enjoy great deals and excellent service from friendly and helpful staff while exploring the various markets in Nuwara Eliya.
name: Nuwara Eliya City
address: XQF8+2PW, New Bazaar Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Kande Ela Reservoir, located near Ambewela, offers a tranquil and peaceful setting for a relaxing getaway. Visitors can enjoy boating and camping in this beautiful spot, making it an ideal escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. The reservoir provides an opportunity to reconnect with nature while enjoying activities such as boat rides and camping under the stars. Additionally, visitors traveling by private vehicle can take a short break to enjoy the scenic views and pleasant climate.
name: Kande Ela Reservoir
address: Sri Lanka

detail_description: Discover the rich history of tea production at Pedro Tea Center and Factory in Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka. Established in 1885, this factory offers visitors a chance to witness the traditional tea-making process using century-old machinery. Take a guided tour to learn about the intricate techniques involved in transforming raw materials into the aromatic beverage enjoyed worldwide. Additionally, explore the lush tea plantations surrounding the factory for an immersive experience in one of Sri Lanka's renowned industries.
name: Pedro Tea Center and Factory
address: Bus Stop, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

name: Simply Strawberries by Jagro (Cafe) - Ambewela, Nuwara Eliya
address: Pattipola - Kirindiela Rd, Kande Ela, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Themparadu is a casual Sri Lankan restaurant in Nuwara Eliya, offering an extensive buffet and excellent food. The friendly service and lovely outdoor seating with garden views make for a pleasant dining experience. Wheelchair accessibility ensures inclusivity for all guests. Overlooking Victoria Park, the restaurant is known for its delicious kottu and other Sri Lankan delicacies. Another popular dining spot in the area is Grand India, serving delectable Indian dishes.
name: Themparadu
address: Upper Lake Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Salmiya Italian Restaurant is a cozy spot known for its Middle Eastern cuisine and ability to cater to specific dietary needs. The restaurant offers vegetarian and vegan options, making it a great choice for travelers with allergy concerns. Visitors rave about the delicious thin-crust pizza generously topped with flavorful ingredients. The small, clean establishment is run by a lovely lady who goes out of her way to accommodate special requests, such as preparing unique garlic bread upon demand.
name: Salmiya Italian Restaurant
address: 122 PBC Hwy, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Nestled within the Grand Hotel complex in Nuwara Eliya, Tea Lounge offers a delightful experience for tea enthusiasts. The elegant setting boasts modern decor and provides a choice of seating either outdoors on the well-kept lawn or indoors in the airy dining room. Indulge in high-quality Ceylon tea accompanied by delectable finger foods and snacks during high tea. It's an ideal spot to savor authentic Ceylon tea while enjoying a chic ambiance reminiscent of English aristocracy.
name: Grand Veranda
address: Grand Hotel Rd, Nuwara 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Lake View Pub is a charming establishment located within the Alpine Hotel, offering stunning views of the Nuwara Eliya Racecourse and Gregory Lake. The pub exudes an air of exclusivity with its antique furniture and cozy ambiance. Inside, guests can relax on leather sofas or chat with the friendly bar staff while enjoying a cold beer or craft cocktail.
name: Lake View Pub
address: 4 Haddon Hill Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: The Pub in Nuwara Eliya is a historic bar with an old English tavern atmosphere, popular among both tourists and locals seeking a cozy spot for a cold beer. This British-style pub offers a wide range of local and international beers and spirits, along with tasty Western dishes as a refreshing alternative to the local cuisine. The restaurant has ample space for guests, but parking can be challenging due to its central location.
name: The Pub - Nuwara Eliya
address: XQF8+RMH, Old Uda Pussellawa Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Yoho The Train View is a guesthouse located in Nuwara Eliya, offering complimentary Wi-Fi and amenities such as laundry facilities and luggage storage. Guests have praised the owners for their hospitality, with one visitor expressing gratitude for their flexibility in accommodating an early check-in and providing food late at night. Another guest highlighted the helpfulness of the owner, Salva, who arranged a scooter rental and served delicious meals prepared by his wife.
name: The Train View
address: Edinburgh Estate road, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: The Fruit Market in Nuwara Eliya is a must-visit spot for fruit lovers. Located in the city center, it offers a wide variety of tropical fruits as well as local produce. While prices may be higher compared to other cities in Sri Lanka, the market provides an opportunity to sample and purchase an array of delicious fruits such as mangoes, passion fruit, pears, strawberries, oranges, apples, and grapes.
name: Fruit Market
address: XQC8+8Q8, Badulla Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Bomburu Falls in Sri Lanka is renowned for being the widest waterfall in the country, cascading down a 2000 m tall cliff into a pool below. Accessible via a 14 km drive from Nuwara Eliya and a short trek from the well-maintained road, this popular tourist attraction offers stunning natural beauty. Along the hike, visitors can find several stalls selling drinks and local street food. It is important to exercise caution while swimming in these picturesque falls due to potential hazards.
name: Upper Bomburu Falls
address: WRXJ+37, Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka

detail_description: When exploring Sri Lanka, the bus stop is your gateway to an affordable travel experience. While the buses may not always be the most dependable option, they offer a budget-friendly way to navigate this beautiful island. Just keep in mind that travel times can stretch longer than expected due to road disruptions caused by unpredictable weather conditions. Embrace the adventure and check out local resources for bus schedules and routes!
name: Bus stop
address: WQXF+P9P, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

name: Cemetery of Sir Samuel Baker
address: XQC8+Q7M, Golf Club, Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka

name: Little England by Joes
address: lot 24 , little england cottages, moon plain, 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: The Kande Ela Educational Forest Park is situated in a breathtaking location and boasts a diverse array of wildlife and plant species. It stands out among other forest reserves in the upcountry region due to its exceptional collection of plants. Visitors can embark on an enjoyable and secure journey through this park, which typically takes around one hour to complete but can be extended for those who find it captivating.
name: Kande Ela Educational Forest Park
address: WQ6V+J3R, Road, Kande Ela,, Pattipola, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Nuwara Eliya, often referred to as "the city above the clouds," is renowned for its breathtaking landscapes and high-altitude tea production. This charming destination is home to Sri Lanka's finest teas, with Dilmah being the most celebrated brand sourced from this picturesque region. If you're a tea enthusiast or simply wish to explore historical colonial tea estates, Nuwara Eliya offers an unforgettable experience steeped in rich culture and stunning scenery.
name: Nuwara Eliya
address: WQXQ+VJQ, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Sure, I'd be happy to help! Please provide me with the list of descriptions about "Temple" that you'd like me to paraphrase.
name: Temple
address: XQ2J+W6H, Blackpool - Magasthota Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka

name: Moon plains mini worlds end
address: WRVC+65, Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Large preserve on a plateau featuring cloud forests & montane grasslands, plus rivers & waterfalls.
detail_description: Horton Plains National Park is a vast expanse located on a plateau, showcasing cloud forests and montane grasslands, as well as rivers and waterfalls. This park has a rich history, having been named after Wilmert Horton, the British Governor in Ceylon during colonial times. Designated as a wildlife refuge in 1969, it was also listed on the World Heritage List in 2010 due to its biodiversity.
name: Horton Plains National Park
address: Sri Lanka

excerpt: A hike to this small, scenic waterfall also offers sweeping views of tea plantations & the city.
detail_description: Lover's Leap Waterfall is a charming natural attraction that can be reached through a scenic hike. The trail not only leads to the picturesque waterfall but also provides stunning panoramic views of tea plantations and the surrounding city.
name: Lover's leap Waterfall
address: sandasewana',holbrook, Agrapatana 22200, Sri Lanka

name: Ambewela Farm
address: VQ9W+P72, New Zealand Farms Road, Ambewela, Sri Lanka

detail_description: St. Clair Falls is a stunning Sri Lankan waterfall located along the popular Colombo to Nuwara Eliya route, making it easily accessible for travelers. Situated between Hatton and Thalawakele, this natural wonder offers a picturesque sight, especially on rainy days when its beauty is enhanced. The Sri Lanka Electricity Board maintains a scenic viewpoint and an electricity-related museum nearby, adding an educational aspect to the visit.
name: St. Clair Falls
address: XJ2X+M6V, Talawakelle, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Shree Bhakta Hanuman Koyil - Ramboda, located on a hill in Nuwara Eliya, offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape and a serene atmosphere for spiritual reflection. The temple features an 18-foot-tall reclining Hanuman statue and provides a tranquil space for worship, along with amenities such as a cafe and gift shop. It is known for its well-maintained grounds and friendly staff who are knowledgeable about the temple's history.
name: Shree Bhakta Hanuman Kovil - Ramboda
address: 3MGH+2W7, Tawalantenne, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Striking, 97-m. waterfall on the Kotmale Oya River, viewable from a nearby observation point.
detail_description: Devon Falls is a magnificent 97-meter waterfall located on the Kotmale Oya River in Central Province, Sri Lanka. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking views of the falls from a nearby observation point. The area is known for its picturesque landscapes and lush greenery, making it a popular spot for nature enthusiasts. While some travelers recommend visiting the St. Clair viewpoint for a better perspective of the falls, others appreciate the opportunity to purchase fresh and affordable avocados from local vendors in the area.
name: Devon Falls
address: XJ2J+H26, Nawalapitiya - Dimbula Rd, Dimbula, Sri Lanka

detail_description: Labookellie Tea Lounge offers a top-notch experience with high-quality products like tea cake and chocolate cake, as well as exceptional tea. The friendly service and wheelchair accessibility make it welcoming to all visitors. The lounge boasts breathtaking views and numerous photo opportunities. Visitors can witness the tea-making process firsthand and interact with the workers to learn more about the operations. Guided tours provide insightful information on tea production, including videos showcasing the process. Multilingual guides ensure that everyone can fully engage in the experience.
name: Damro Tea Factory - Labookellie Tea Lounge
address: 2PF9+PHR, A5, Labugolla, Sri Lanka

excerpt: Home to the country's radar system, this prominent peak is also Sri Lanka's tallest mountain.
name: Pidurutalagala
address: 22200, Sri Lanka

detail_description: St. Francis Xavier's Church is a beautiful and welcoming church located in Nuwara Eliya, Sri Lanka. It boasts impressive colonial-era architecture with elegant British design elements. As one of the oldest churches in the country, it holds historical significance and houses old relics. The spacious interior can accommodate around 200 people, offering a quiet and calm atmosphere for visitors to enjoy. Additionally, the church has a small outlet selling products made by the community.
name: St. Francis Xavier's Church
address: 2016 Bandaranaike Mawatha, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka
